summary: This is an email from a prosecutor's office containing a draft opposition to Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss her indictment on the grounds that it was returned by a White Plains grand jury. The email includes attachments of the draft opposition, a redlined comparison with another case, and Maxwell's motion for reference.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the legal correspondence; the draft opposition is in response to her motion to dismiss the indictment against her on procedural grounds related to the grand jury location.

persons.name: Balde

events.title: Drafting of Opposition to Maxwell's Motion
events.description: Prosecutors from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York circulate a draft opposition to Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss her indictment.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell filed a motion to dismiss her indictment on the grounds that it was returned by a grand jury in White Plains.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was preparing a legal opposition to Maxwell's motion to dismiss.
The prosecution's draft opposition was being compared to legal briefing from a separate case involving a defendant named Balde.
The document is internal correspondence between prosecutors, indicating active litigation in Maxwell's case as of February 2021.
